name: Hyatt Regency Sacramento

reviews.text: I stayed at the Hyatt for two nights on a weekend while visiting Sacramento for a wedding. The property itself is located in a nice area, with Capitol Park directly across the street and a view of the Capitol building from my room. Check-in was easy.
reviews.title: Serviceable yet not stellar

reviews.text: I had requested a non-smoking room. When I arrived at the room I had originally been assigned I opened the door to smell cigarette smoke. I called down to clarify my room choice. I was immediately told that I would be moved to a more satisfactory room and asked if I would prefer to pick up my key at the front desk or have a bellman bring me my key.
reviews.title: Eh, Hyatt has much to be desired

reviews.text: The new room was nice and clean though the furnishings showed a bit of wear including dents and scratches on various pieces of furniture. Service was great throughout the stay mwith the exception that my wake up call was 15 minutes late. Parking is a bit pricy, even by downtown standards, at $17 per day for self-park.
reviews.title: Better than average, but typical downtown dead zone on weekend...

likes.disliked: — Downtown core was dead during the weekend

reviews.title: Great If You Don't Have to Park
reviews.text: Overall, I'd stay again, but other things equal I'd probably look to the Sheraton first.
I've stayed here with my company on business travel a few times. The last time is probably my last...
reviews.title: Terrible Service

likes.disliked: — Unmade bed, left at the airport, poor staff service and communication

reviews.text: I have stayed at this hotel several times in the past two years and I ALWAYS have a great experience. The staff is great, the rooms extremely nice and the hotel decor pleasing. I have never spent over $200 for a room (even a club room). They have gone out of their way to make my stay a great one.
reviews.title: Always pleased

likes.liked: — I feel like I am coming home when I enter the hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hyatt for two nights while in town for a wedding and the fire alarm went off BOTH NIGHTS! Each time the ear peircing sound continued for up to 30 minutes while we were instructed to wait in our rooms for further instructions. It isn't very reassuring sitting in your room on the 12th floor, for 30 mintues with the alarm sounding with no further instructions or information - and almost impossible to get back to sleep after that. Although it is not the hotel's fault that someone pulled the alarm, they handled it very poorly by not getting information to us quicker. This hotel appeared to have an abundance of obnoxious, unsupervised teenagers who surely were to blame for pulling the alarm each night. Perhaps an increase of security is needed.
reviews.title: Don't plan on getting any sleep!

reviews.text: In addition to the fire alarm, the hotel was generally loud even though we were on the Regency Club floor. The Regency Club was nice and had a better breakfast than I expected. Although it was still a continental type breakfast there were bagels and lox, and pastries that looked better than the usual free breakfasts. We were also able to use a computer on the floor to print our boarding passes for our return flight.
reviews.title: One of the worst Hyatt properties

likes.liked: — Front Desk staff and hotel management
likes.disliked: — There are better options in Sacramento and better Hyatt properties elsewhere

description: A premier hotel beckons with world-class amenities located adjacent to the convention center and the State Capitol. This mediterranean-style hotel is an ideal setting for meetings and receptions. Fresh from a $15M renovations, the hotel sets the standard for business excellence with 503 elegant rooms, including 17 suites, Hyatt Business Plant and exclusive Regency Club accommodations.
